Vec¶

class decodes.core.dc_vec.Vec(a=0, b=0, c=0)¶

Bases: decodes.core.dc_base.Geometry

a simple vector class

__init__(a=0, b=0, c=0)¶

Vector Constructor.

Parameters:
  • a (float) – a value.
  • b (float) – b value
  • c (float) – c value
Result :

Vector object.
Return type:

Vec

 
my_vec=Vec(1,1,1)

vec_1=Vec(Point(1,1,1))

vec_2=Vec(Point(0,0,0), Point(1,1,1))
angle(other)¶

Returns the angle in radians between this vector and the other vector. Return value is constrained to the range [-PI,PI].

Parameters:other (Vec) – Second vector for angle calculation.
Result :Angle in radians.
Return type:float 
my_vec.angle(vec_1)
angle_deg(other)¶

Returns the angle in degrees between this vector and the other vector.

Parameters:other (Vec) – Second vector to for angle calculation.
Result :Angle in degrees.
Return type:float
static average(vecs)¶

Returns the average of a list of vectors.

Parameters:vecs (list) – List of vectors to average.
Result :Averaged vector.
Return type:Vec 
Vec.average(my_vec, vec_1)
static bisector(v0, v1)¶

Returns the normalized bisector of two vectors.

Parameters:
  • v0 (Vec) – First vector to get the bisector from.
  • v1 (Vec) – Second vector to get the bisector from.
Result :

Bisector vector.
Return type:

Vec

 
Vec.bisector(vec_1, vec_2)
cross(other)¶
Return a new vector, the cross product.
a x b = (a2b3 - a3b2, a3b1 - a1b3, a1b2 - a2b1)
This will be at right angles to both self and other, with a length.
Parameters:other (Vec) – Second vector to calculate cross product.
Result :New vector.
Return type:Vec 
len(self) * len(other) * sin(angle_between_them)

my_vec.cross(vec_1)
dot(other)¶

Computes the dot product of this vector and the other vector.

Parameters:other (Vec) – Second vector to compute dot product.
Result :Dot product.
Return type:float 
my_vec.dot(vec_2)

Interpolates between vectors v0 and v1 at param t.

  • v1 (Vec) – Second Vec.
  • t (float) – Parameter to interpolate at between the vectors.
Result :

Interpolated vector.

Returns True if the vectors have equal direction.

Parameters:other (Vec) – Vec to be compared.

  • tol (float) – Tolerance of difference.

Parameters:other (Vec) – Vec to be compared.
Result :Boolean result of comparison.

length¶

Returns the length of this vector. Use vec.length2 when possible, as it is cheaper to calculate.

Result :Length of the Vec.
Return type:float 
my_vec.length
length2¶

Length squared. Cheaper to calculate than vec.length.

Result :Length of the Vec.
Return type:float 
my_vec.length2
limited(n=1.0)¶

Returns a new vector limited to a given length.

Parameters:n (float) – Value to limit the Vec’s length.
Result :Limited vector.
Return type:Vec 
my_vec.limited()
normalized(length=1.0)¶

Return a new vector in the same direction, but given length (default 1.0).

Parameters:length (float) – New length for the Vec (default 1.0)
Result :Normalized vector.
Return type:Vec

projected(other)¶

Parameters:other (Vec) – Destination vector.
Result :Projected vector.
Return type:Vec 
my_vec.projected(vec_2)
projected_length(other)¶

Returns the length of the vector which results from projecting a vector onto a destination vector.

Parameters:other (Vec) – Destination vector.
Result :Projected vector length.
Return type:float 
my_vec.projected_length(vec_2)
static random(interval=None, normalize=True, constrain2d=False)¶

Returns a random vector within a given interval.

Parameters:
  • interval (Interval) – Interval to get the random values from.
  • normalize (bool) – If True, unitizes the Vec.
  • constrain2d (bool) – If True, the Vec is constrained to 2d space.
Result :

Random vector.
Return type:

Vec

 
Vec.random(Interval(1,10))
rounded(n=0)¶

Returns a new vector with coords rounded to n-digits (defaults to 0 digits (nearest int).

Parameters:n (int) – Number of digits to round the Vec’s coordinates.
Result :Rounded vector.
Return type:Vec 
my_vec.rounded()
